description: I am using it for AngularJS, NodeJS,PHP,JSP,C,C++ and it works like charm
Modern interface? Check. Customizations? Check. Supports tons of languages and images? Check. Plugins / User-made content? Check. OpenSource? Check. Just perfect.
It's less complex than an IDE like eclipse ut I wish it would be faster and lighter expecially on start up.
I use this exclusively for all of my projects. A great editor for php, html, css, js, etc.
This program is the best for text editing and for developing programs.
summary: My favorite program for editing plain files

description: This text editor is excellent for web dev. I migrated from Aptana studio, a few bugs here in there, but it satisfies all my needs.
I used it to play with HTML, CSS and JS.
Need more optimizations
Love the editor.

I've been using Atom since it was first available on Linux/Windows, and I've been very happy for the most part. It does get a little slow when working on large files, but for the light-medium work I tend to do with it, its perfect.
Simple, free, powerful. The apm package manager is great for quickly setting up your editor.
Personally, I enjoy VIM. However, I do think its a very cool and easily customizable UI that makes this a really neat editor.

I have tried quite some IDE's and editors, but I keep coming back to this one.
Excellent work (in progress)!
Awesome tool for coding
This is a great editor! Looks fantastic and is functional - very intuitive to use.
The best editor for developers, but actually the latest version is 1.14.
Best text editor!
I used Sublime Text for the past few years and loved it, but it doesn't get regular updates and seems to rely on a single developer. Atom offers everything that Sublime Text does and much much more!
Lightweight, modular and open source.
Great packages to customize workflow, doesn't have to leave the editor.
I love atom. its my favorite code-editor but it uses a lot of my ram space... please see how it can be made to use little memory space.
summary: Nice app but uses a lot of memory space

description: You can expand their functions with users made plugins.
I am so glad this exists on Linux. It's one of the reasons I switched from Windows after not playing games for quite some time.
Manages to compete with other editors despite being a web app. Plugins are great. Wish it was faster though.
The best text editor and IDE. I write my c code here and aslo html and css.
All and all it's one of the text-editor that i would use to work on projects.It's packages brings it to power and it's live-server package, it's crazy!
No words for it.
Perfect text editor on Linux. And I'm even thinking about migrating from Notepad++ to Atom on Windows.
Really good but slow down sometimes even i don't install too many packages. The main disadvantages i have download full application from website just to update it.
Fast, stable and powerful.

Dumb as hell as is, plugin quality is bad, inconsistent configuration. Can't even format, auto-indent and auto wrap HTML, XML or Javascript files, tried multiple plugins, none of them worked properly. Visual Studio Code does it out of the box like a charm. Tried to give it a chance, liked the fact it's easy to extend, but so basic use-case like formatting code needs struggling through tons of low quality plugins... doesn't worth it, it's not for me.
Why isn't this available on Fedora repos?
It's the best code editor. It's a bit slow but if you have a decent machine it will work perfectly.
Really worked well for me. PHP syntax checking works well. Easy plugin installation. Free to use.
summary: Better then Sublime, Eclipse and NetBeans

description: Possibly the best text editor out there.

Very modern and great customization available. Just wish they would add a live preview for html/css like brackets. That's the only thing missing. Otherwise there is multiple amazing features that is no where else to be found.
A great open source editor. Really improved over the years; faster startup now, and easily extensible without getting in the way.
Best Text Editor ever!

description: Nothing bad about this app. Really amazing!
awesome look and wonderfool collection
Does a great job doing whatever I need.
best

I use this awesome IDE for react and react-native development
One of the best Code editor for Web Development. Includes best packages and extensions. Loved it!
works well for code and stuff

It's prefectly prefect
the extensions are awesome, very well supported. you can do everything with this
i have tried Sublime for Linux but was not satisfied. Also Visual Studio Code is nice, but ended up to Atom eventually

description: Everything you need
excelente editor

description: My favourite IDE for everything right after Kate... Perfect and extensions make it even better.

description:
The great, hackable editor from GitHub. Very robust and extensible. Can get somewhat slow if you bog it down.
Started using when I was still a Windows-only scrub.
Atom is a great IDE. Love the UI, intuitive, good marketplace for themes and extensions. GIT integration is very useful.
I use Atom more than I probably should. Its awesome.

That said: Do I have more than enough for Atom on a budget laptop? Absolutely.
Everyone who's bothered by the ram consumption should stop looking at stats and start realizing it doesn't really matter. Atom is great.
summary: Does it consume lots of RAM? Sure

description: The flatpak package doesn't stay up to date when new upstream versions are released. Still on 1.26.0 after a couple of weeks of not updating to 1.26.1, and now 1.27.0 is out.
summary: Program's good, but package is often out of date

description:
The Atom editor works as normal, everything built-in is fine.
This Flatpak version has problems with some plugins that requires external bin, like linters (ex. for PHP) or wallaby.js (which requires node, but it says it's not in path).

description: This App is Awesome
Perfect editor, simple but powerful, especially for web develop
The best text editor for Linux.

description: I use it for python developing, this is a Great app
Excellent editor for html, css, js, svg, md
The best text editor for programming purposes.
Too cool for school.
I have used it before and it was very good, but sice the last update I couldn't even open it!

Works perfectly, and no memory leak. Sadly for an programing ide, flatpak is not that good idea. I have this bunch of external apps, that atom uses like node by the Script plugin to run javascript on the editor, and I'm days on the hunt for a fix and I'm not able to run it on flatpak because it isn't able to access node from system.

Tried several text editors and IDEs, including VScode, vim, rstudio, pycharm, jupyter, etc. But always keep coming back to atom. Admittedly used to be slow, especially compared to vscode, but atom's performance has caught up, with tons of other functionality that vscode just can't provide. Just can't live without hydrogen and juno for julia.
summary: Great multi-purpose text editor, definitely recommend!

description:
I am yet to see a workable IDE being ported to flatpak. Do the devs not realize that it's a waste of time trying to create a confined IDE? It doesn't have unlimited access to the system resources.

Tried installing a Rust package, but looks like even searching is broken. Sad.
summary: It's completely pointless to create a flatpak for IDEs. Complete joke

description: Really help ....
The others have said it all. Fully customizable, open source, and can read anything I have the ability to write. So I use it. A lot.
I litary kicked of VS Code ATOM IS THAT GOOD it was the best experice i recomend atom for newbies and pros
Don't want to use a microsoft IDE? Use this one!
I grew up with a game called Killer Instinct and power mode in Atom will remind you that game haha!
does everything you need
A generally unresponsive and buggy experience with hanging and crashes. Plus there is no way to edit files of a network drive as network drives don't show up.

I love Atom, but some packages do not work properly or too much code-configuration to be done for my specifications, e.g. Ruby.
I have to switch to VS Code - most of the packages work well.

description: the best code edtor
This hot modern code editor, customization and supporting popular extensions is worth having.

Git integration is amazing. Love that it's highly customizable. Visually it is beautiful. 
Large xml file issue is annoying. 
What brought me back to VsCode was that it just works out of the box. Atom on the other than is reliant on plugins - even simple thing like cursor history, syntax checking etc...
For now, Atom is 2nd best for me
best text editor i've ever used
Good interpreters especially for python and C. really smooth and easy to use, hope to see some enhancements in some other interpreters
excellent app for php developers but not best while phpstorm is alive
good for python.. love it
My favorite code editor
i Propose this APP to You
complete free & opensource and beutifull looking ui IDE

Just download it!
i was using it for js, php, c, c++ when in college then started using vs code while doing job but personally i use atom

description: Awesome editor to work with. I love Atom and I would highly recommend you try it out
The Best App I have been used.
I want to use app every day
Beinhaltet alles was ich benötige
Super Editor der viele Sprachen unterstützt. Toll ist auch die Möglichkeit den Editor mit Erweiterungen zu persönlichen.
Mein Lieblings Editor, und dank der Erweiterungen auch gut anpassbar
Sehr gute und vielseitige IDE. Definitiv zu empfehlen.
Ich nutze Atom für mein Informatikstudium und das Programm erfüllt seinen Zweck und ist auch aufgrund der Automatischen Einfärbung auch sehr übersichtlich, auch bei längeren Quelltexten

Best editor I could find so far. Syntax highlighting and completion for the supported programming languages, lots of plugins available.
A pro tool for free!

Als Editor mit grafischer Oberfläche unschlagbar. Es gibt unzählige Erweiterungen, auch viele zu Markdown etc. Ich bearbeite damit Markdown, CSS und HTML-Dateien. Die Bedienung ist einfach, die Darstellung perfekt. Toll!
And that's it basicly.
Sehr guter Editor. Durch viele Packages erweiterbar.
Solo le hecho en falta atajos de teclado para cambiar de espacio de trabajo cuando lo tengo dividido en 2
Sencillo pero potente. Está en inglés.
Deben integrar el soporte del lenguaje scss, el emmet, entre otros plugin.
Es uno de los programas que instalo siempre. Solo superado por visual studio code, pero PROPIETARY SOFTWARE.
Es uno de mis editores preferidos para desarrollo. Recomendado.
Hace tiempo que uso Atom y no lo cambio por nada, solo hace falta mejorar e implementar más funciones, así como tener el idioma en Español.
Uno de los mejores para la edición de html, css, js, php, etc. Quizás un consumo alto de recursos como punto negativo.
Atom ha sido y sigue siendo uno de mis editores favoritos, he trabajado por unos cuantos años ya con él y así seguirá siendo
Como punto débil es que no está en español, pero es muy útil para programar en casi cualquier lenguaje y se integra muy bien.

Para aquellos que no saben poner el programa en español, deben istalar el paquete ""atom-i18n" .  Con esto se instalan los lenguajes pero hay que ir a las propiedades y seleccionar el idioma español.
Por lo demás es perfecto para programar.

Es perfecta!
Pero falla la funcion de recordar cuentas de git en esta version es mejor descargar de atom.io
summary: Es perfecta! pero falla la funcion de recordar cuentas de git

description: Durante el año pasado un compañero de clase me lo recomendo por la facilidad de usar y el poder realizar proyectos en grupo mas facilmente y basicamente me enamoro, despues de que se acabaran las clases no volvi a abrir la aplicacion(o mejor dicho intentar) hasta febrero de este año pero ni por el terminal ni por el icono se abre, ya prove reinstalar la aplicación, actualizar el sistema operativo a la ultima versión y descargarlo desde el terminal pero el resultado es el mismo, realmente es un software muy recomendable pues el autocompletado de las ordenes hace la vida mucho mas facil y el realizar largos proyectos mucho mas llevadero y comodo, le habria dado las 5 estrellas si no hubiera tenido este problema que me hace imposible el usar este software.
summary: Me encanta pero ya no se abre

description: D locos, muy visual
Le meilleur editeur de texte pour programmeurs!
Agréable, efficace, très polyvalente. Jusqu'à maintenant, je l'ai utilisée pour écrire du Html, Python, GNU make et markdown.
Coloration syntaxique reposant les yeux ! Autocomplétion. Plugins disponibles et paramètrables facilement !
Le meilleur éditeur de texte pour tout programmeurs. Un grand nombre d'extensions, vous pourrez faire tout ce que vous voulez !

Excellent, je conseille vivement cette application. J'utilisais sublime text avant, et maintenant que j'utilise atom pour écrire mes programmes ma vie est simplifiée. Et puis le fait que l'extension de git est directement incluse c'est génial
